front.title: The use of Asserted Identity in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) UPDATE method

abstract.t: SIP has a mechanism for conveying the asserted identity of the originator of a request by means of the P-Asserted-Identity header field. This header field is specified for use in requests using a number of SIP methods, in particular the INVITE method. However, RFC 3325 does not specify the insertion of this header field by a UAC, does not specify the use of this header field with the SIP UPDATE method, and is unclear on the use of this header field in responses. This document extends RFC 3325 to cover these situations. This work is being discussed on the sipping@ietf.org mailing list.
